sources.title: The Rogues Tavern (1936) [Horror] [Mystery]
sources.description:
The Rogues Tavern is a 1936 American film directed by Robert F. Hill about a mad killer is on the loose in a hotel on a dark, gloomy night.

---

Directed by Robert F. Hill, produced by Sam Katzman, written by Al Martin (original screenplay), starring Wallace Ford as Jimmy Kelly, Barbara Pepper as Marjorie Burns, Joan Woodbury as Gloria Robloff, Clara Kimball Young as Mrs. Jamison, Jack Mulhall as Bill, John Elliott as Mr. Jamison, Earl Dwire as Morgan, John Cowell as Hughes, Vincent Dennis as Bert, Arthur Loft as Wentworth, Ivo Henderson as Harrison, Ed Cassidy as Mason and Silver Wolf as Silver Wolf.

---

Source: "The Rogues Tavern" Wikipedia, The Free Encyclopedia. Wikimedia Foundation, Inc.. 27 February 2012. Web. 31 August 2012. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Rogues_Tavern.

If you like this movie and our channel, please subscribe: https://goo.gl/0qDmXe

sources.title: Rogue's Tavern
sources.description: Mysterious murders at a remote inn. In the last few minutes of the file named Rogues_Tavern_1936_loses_synch.avi , which is ripped from a DVD, the sound is slightly unsynchronized with the video. The file named Rogues_Tavern_1936.avi is derived from the 3.8 gigabyte file found here and seems to have no synch problems.

sources.title: The Rogue's Tavern
sources.description: I was annoyed that files derived from this movie lost audio after 17 minutes of play, so that it was necessary to download or play the 3.8 GB MPEG-2 file. The Internet Archive tried to re-derive MPEG-1 and MPEG-4 files from it to fix this audio problem to no avail. I had better luck. The 1.02 GB MPEG-4 file listed was derived from the original MPEG-2 file using settings near the limit of the MPEG-4 codec and deinterlaced. Enjoy! IMDb

metadata.Plot: A mad killer is on the loose in a hotel on a dark, gloomy night.
